channel.title: Resources on Web Type

item.title: Various types of sites
item.description: Below are links to webtype-type sites. The purpose here is to document a variety of web/type use rather than to showcase exemplary samples of content or aesthetics. Reading collections The Avery Review HTML Output Critical Atlas of the Internet Justin McGuirk Poetic Computation Untold Stories Wendy36 Typographic web designs Illuminating Radioactivity XXXI XXXI Intro to Coding Workshop Nathan Tokyo Z-Bau Typeforce Wattis Institute Shiraz Abdullahi Gallab: Headgear Synoptic Office: Chinese Type Archive Russian Type journal Dowse Museum Stedlijk Strelka Alumni Ball Het Nieuwe Institut PACKET Index Art Book Fair Kurimanzutto Sites for Typefaces Fem Type Untitled Sans Hypertext Google Fonts and Chinese Google Fonts and Korean Temporary State Alfatype Gimlet IBM Plex Recursive Type as Form Sweethearts Elswewhere Data Patterns Monomono studio YES YES YES Moonsick Gang Interactive Text place a stone clickclickclick 2013 Lisbon Architecture Triennale Generators Hello from Here Space Type Generator Letters from Sweden: Funkis ABC Metaflop Universal Sans Type and Audio Secousse Radio Laurel Halo Truth and Quantity Goertek Phase Online Publications Rhizome Triple Canopy Triple Canopy: The Binder and the Server E-flux The New Inquiry Rachel Rosenfelt: The New Inquiry The Intercept The Creative Independent Dan Michaelson / Jack Balkin: Sometimes it looks like a duck, sometimes it looks like a rabbit Web Design Studios Linked by Air Rumors Studio Studio Moniker Project Projects General Website Collections Hoverstates Hallo Internet Brutalist Websites Readymag Classics Rafael Rozendaal Jodi.

item.title: Common Errors
item.description: Common errors to watch out for when troubleshooting: HTML Are your HTML elements wrapped in open and close tags? Are your HTML elements properly nested? Do your attribute values have quotation marks around them? Are your directory paths correct? Double check your link syntax. CSS Do you have opening and closing brackets? Does your property and value pairs have colons in between them? Do you have a semicolon at the end of each declaration?

item.title: Glossary
item.description: Tag a tag is used for creating an element, which consists of the name of an HTML element in angle brackets. (i.e. <p> for paragraph.) Element An element is a part of a webpage. A typical element includes an opening tag with some attributes, enclosed text content, and a closing tag. (i.e. <h1 class="news"> Heading </h1>) Attribute An attribute extends a tag, changing its behavior or providing metadata. An attribute always has the form name=value, such as defining the link location (<a href="index.

item.title: Web Resources
item.description: Below are links to some resources for coding. Documentation Mozilla Developer Network Devdocs Guides Publish Something Online What is a URL? Folder Poetry Dealing with files What goes in your head Why Coding Style Matters on Smashing Magazine (with useful list of validators) Writing your Best Code: HTML/CSS coding best practices and list of resources Google developer documentation style guide Sublime Text unofficial documentation & keyboard shortcuts HTML About Semantic HTML elements Overview of newer HTML tags Mix Blend Mode Nth-Child Paragraph Formatting on the Web Character sets: HTML Entities and Character Codes CSS CSS inheritance Shay Howe’s Guides CSS Basics Codecademy A guide to centering things Layout tutorials CSS Tricks Simple Grid Approach Articles on A List Apart: Content-out Layout | The Infinite Grid | Fluid Grids Using Style Tiles Media Queries & Responsive design Responsive Web Design Responsive Design Media Queries 7 Habits of Highly Effective Media Queries mediaqueri.
